sense.name: repeat, imitate, evoke
sense.examples: 'Those people,' she echoed. 'But not you?' He echoed the comment by Ken Flamm that success has many fathers. He echoed Dr. Browing's opinion that the Air Force is in transition from an air force to a space force. In repeating the claim without comment, they echoed conservatives' misleading dichotomy between 'strict constructionists' and 'judicial activists.'

sense.name: resound, reverberate
sense.examples: The canyon echoed with the rhythmic beat of a stone axe. The woods echoed with voices, laughter and a bit of whining. This landmark decision will echo in American courtrooms. Ancient Chinese battle cries echoed through the Communist Party's premier meeting hall.
